result.name: worklessness_summary_statistics_-_economic_activity_rate_and_employment_rate
result.notes:
Annual Population Survey; information on the number and percentage of people who are employed, economically active, and economically inactive.
Source: Office for National Statistics (ONS), Annual Population Survey (APS)
Publisher: Neighbourhood Statistics
Geographies: Local Authority District (LAD), Government Office Region (GOR), National
Geographic coverage: England and Wales
Time coverage: April 2005 - March 2006 to April 2006 - March 2007
Type of data: Survey

odi-certificate.title: Worklessness Summary Statistics: Economic activity rate and employment rate

organization.name: office-for-national-statistics
organization.title: Office for National Statistics
organization.description:
The Office for National Statistics (ONS) is the UK’s largest independent producer of official statistics and is the recognised national statistical institute for the UK. It is responsible for collecting and publishing statistics related to the economy, population and society at national, regional and local levels. It also conducts the census in England and Wales every ten years. 

The ONS plays a leading role in national and international good practice in the production of official statistics. It is the executive office of the UK Statistics Authority and although they are separate, they are still closely related.

result.precision: #95% confidence intervals have been published to provide a measure of this uncertainty. For each for each data value one can be 95% certain the true value lies between the lower and upper confidence limits. Counts and rates for economic activity, employment, and economic inactivity are derived from the ONS Annual Population Survey (APS). This is a National Statistics product and is therefore produced to a high standard. The figures are based on a sample survey, so (as with all surveys) some assumptions have been made about the entire population of each area based on the survey sample. Therefore there is some inherent uncertainty around the data published and the true value.#Data rounded to the nearest 100.
result.title: Worklessness Summary Statistics: Economic activity rate and employment rate
